interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mary Poppins (Two-Disc 45th Anniversary Special Edition) [DVD]
Review Date: 2013/05/13
Store: Julie Andrews  (Actor),     Dick Van Dyke  (Actor),     Robert Stevenson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Musicals
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The movie received 13 Academy Award(R) nominations and won 5 Oscars(R) for Best Actress, Best Song, Best Music Score, Best Film Editing, and Best Special Visual Effects. It also received a special scientific award for the creation and application of Color Traveling Matte Composite Cinematography, which helped make the combination of live action and animated actors in the film possible.', 'Amazon.com', 'There is only one word that comes close to accurately describing the enchanting', 'Mary Poppins', ', and that term was coined by the movie itself: supercalifragilisticexpialidocious! Even at 2 hours and 20 minutes, Disney\'s pioneering mixture of live action and animation (based on the books by P.L. Travers) still holds kids spellbound. Julie Andrews won an Oscar as the world\'s most magically idealized nanny ("practically perfect in every way," and complete with lighter-than-air umbrella), and Dick Van Dyke is her clownishly charming beau, Bert the chimney sweep. The songs are also terrific, ranging from bright and cheery ("A Spoonful of Sugar") to dark and cheery (the Oscar-winning "Chim Chim Cher-ee") to touchingly melancholy ("Feed the Birds"). Many consider', 'Mary Poppins', "to be the crowning achievement of Walt Disney's career--and it was the only one of his features to be nominated for a best picture Academy Award until", 'Beauty and the Beast', 'in 1991.', '--Jim Emerson', 'Stills from', 'Mary Poppins', '(Click for larger image)']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Color, Dolby, AC-3, DVD, NTSC, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Julie Andrews, Hermione Baddeley, Glynis Johns, Robert Stevenson, Dick Van Dyke, Matthew Garber, Elsa Lanchester, David Tomlinson, Karen Dotrice, Reta ShawJulie Andrews, Hermione Baddeley, Glynis Johns, Robert Stevenson, Dick Van Dyke, Matthew Garber, Elsa Lanchester, David Tomlinson, Karen Dotrice, Reta Shaw   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.66:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.4 x 0.55 inches; 7.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Robert Stevenson', 'Media Format': 'Color, Dolby, AC-3, DVD, NTSC, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 27, 2009', 'Actors': 'Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson, Glynis Johns, Hermione Baddeley', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: You can't feel grumpy after watching this movie. There are so many classic tunes and scenes. Steppin' Time , and "I love to laugh" are some that just leave me feeling great . They just do not make them like this anymore.
Review Title: Joy in a box
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Mr North
Anthony Edwards  (Actor),     Robert Mitchum  (Actor),     Danny Huston  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
['Product Description', "Anthony Edwards, Mary Stuart Masterson and Virginia Madsen star with a cast of luminaries, including Robert Mitchum, Harry Dean Stanton, Anjelica Huston, Tammy Grimes and Lauren Bacall, in this heartwarming and hilarious fable about a man who sets a wealthy community's hair on end literally! When young Yale graduate Theophilus North (Edwards) settles in Newport, Rhode Island, in 1926, he charms the elite with his ability to heal with an unusual energy that flows from his fingertips. But as North gains a reputation as a savior, he simultaneously endures the wrath of the local doctor, who labels him a charlatan. Suddenly this gifted newcomer must defend his honor before his unique talent sparks a backlash that lands him in jail!", 'Amazon.com', "T. Theopholis North (Anthony Edwards) is an aspiring adventurer making do as a tutor and reader to the upper-crust in 1920s Newport, Rhode Island, in Danny Huston's enchanting if rough-edged adaptation of Thornton Wilder's", 'comic novel', ". Equally at home with the rich (Robert Mitchum's blustery but big-hearted philosopher millionaire) and the poor (butler and all-around-town character Harry Dean Stanton), the young man with an electric personality (literally) becomes a liberator, a matchmaker, a reluctant faith healer, and a tonic for a community in the thrall of charlatans. Huston, son of the great John Huston (who helped script the film), is not a deft filmmaker, but he has a welcoming warmth and a contagious affection for his colorful characters. If his cast (which includes Lauren Bacall, Mary Stuart Masterson, and Anjelica Huston, Danny's sister) tends to overplay their parts, it's in the genial spirit of this lighthearted lark.", '--Sean Axmaker']

Ames, John Huston, Sandra Birnhak Ames', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'James Costigan, Janet Roach, John Huston, Thornton Wilder', 'Number of discs': '1'}
So glad we could find it here on DVD. It is packed with stars and gentle humor. It prompted us to read the book it is based upon, and we like the movie better in this case.It is not mainstream, but is treasured at our house!
We love this little movie!

Enjoyable quirky little movie
Knight and Day (Single-Disc Edition)
Tom Cruise  (Actor),     Cameron Diaz  (Actor),     James Mangold  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['Product Description', 'Big screen superstars Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz come together in this fun, action-packed thrill-ride that will keep you on the edge of your seat. When a small-town girl named June (Diaz) meets a mysterious stranger, she thinks she\'s found the man of her dreams. But she soon discovers he\'s a fugitive super-spy, who thrusts her into a thrilling cat-and-mouse chase that spans the globe. As the bullets and sparks fly, June must decide if her "Knight" in shining armor is a dangerous traitor or the love of her life.', 'Amazon.com', 'Knight and Day', 'has action by the boatload, cheeky wit, unexpected double-crossing, sexual tension, and the blinding smile of its star, Tom Cruise. In short, what more could you ask of a rollicking good-time movie?', 'Knight and Day', ", which also stars the irresistible Cameron Diaz as Cruise's superspy's ultimate foil, channels the best elements of earlier films like", 'Mr. and Mrs. Smith', ',', 'Mission: Impossible', ', the', 'Bourne', 'films, and even a little of', 'Duplicity', "'s sophistication. Mostly, though,", 'Knight and Day', 'is about moving things along merrily, if not completely coherently, as the two stars tangle, and tussle with trust issues, in a completely believable, compulsively watchable way. Cruise plays Roy, an on-the-lam spy (who may have had some kind of psychotic break--or who may in fact be the only person telling the truth); he runs into the winsome June (Diaz), who gets caught up in Roy\'s mad dash to escape the cabal of federal agents on his tail. "No one follows us," Roy announces to a terrified diner crowd as he moves to make his escape with June, "or I kill myself--and then her." While', 'Knight and Day', ', directed by James Mangold, has more than its share of high-speed chases, hails of bullets, and explosions, it works far better as a romantic comedy--for the chemistry between Diaz and Cruise is delicious, palpable, and believable. So grab a date and an extra-large popcorn, and get ready for a sweet and fun', 'Knight and Day', '. --', 'A.T. Hurley']
{'Genre': 'Action/Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed', 'Contributor': 'Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, James Mangold', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.54 x 5.37 x 7.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOXS2267223DVD', 'Director': 'James Mangold', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed', 'Run time': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 30, 2010', 'Actors': 'Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This one is a bit of a guilty pleasure. It definitely strains credibility ,but so do many fun action movies. It is like an amusement ride,it gives my brain a rest from stress, and makes me smile at the finish. It is a fun break as far as I am concerned. Though I am not a huge Tom Cruise fan(or Cameron Diaz - though I own on or two of their other movies), the chemistry is so good here , I enjoy it thoroughly.I worked in a video store for 10 years and have pretty eclectic tastes ,  this one  just goes under fun.
Action packed fun.
Strangers in Good Company
Mary Meigs  (Actor),     Beth Webber  (Actor),     Cynthia Scott  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Comedy
['Product Description', "In this film by Academy Award winner Cynthia Scott, seven old women become stranded at a deserted farmhouse miles from civilization. They don't have much food, or a decent place to sleep. Or much in common. But these surprising, remarkable women turn a crisis into a magical time of humor and spirit.", 'Amazon.com', "This touching, 1991 Canadian film directed by Cynthia Scott takes the unusual step of casting nonprofessional actors, and the gamble pays off very well indeed. The story concerns eight elderly women whose tour bus breaks down driving through the wilderness. While waiting to be rescued, they find an abandoned house and look for food. The days and nights they end up spending away from civilization prove restorative to their spirits as each character gets an opportunity to tell her life story. The ensemble cast, as it turns out, essentially plays themselves in the film: the tales they tell are truly their own. A very talky, slowly paced production, it's best to get into the gentle rhythm of Scott's design and let the experience flow in the same way it does for the performers.", '--Tom Keogh', 'Review', 'Sweet, unpretentious, charmingly low-keyed and appealing all the way through. A genuine tonic. --The New York TimesEloquently witty and touching! There may be bigger, costlier, weightier films around; there are none lovelier! --Peter Travers, Rolling StoneBoth witty and wise-an epiphany for the price of a movie ticket! --Philadelphia Inquirer', 'See more']

I hunted for this movie, it had been a lot of years since I viewed it . It has stuck with me though. it is a movie that helps awaken a feeling of inner strength and a can do attitude. Even though these old lady's have problems and are not perfect ,they manage to pull it together and survive on their own.
A great transformation movie
Mrs. Henderson Presents (Widescreen Edition)
Judi Dench  (Actor),     Bob Hoskins  (Actor),     Stephen Frears  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
['Mrs. Laura Henderson may be a widow but she is by no means going to spend the rest her days playing bridge. The Windmill Theater becomes her game and the infamous showman Vivian Van Dam becomes her partner and fiercest opponent. The Germans are bombing London but the roar of the Windmill is all that can be heard, as Laura convinces Lord Cromer to allow her actresses to be the one thing no one could ever imagine: Nude. Brought to its knees by war, what Mrs. Henderson Presents brings a nation to its feet in applause.']

I bought this one blind. Judi Dench does not disappoint. It took me right to the WWII era and I found it sweet , sad, and touching , but also funny in places, just like life in general
Interesting hisorical view

The acting is perfect. The setting authentic and the human life lessons are pretty universal. It consider it a teaching movie that shows how much a good life is about what you believe and how it affects what you perceive.
Wonderful movie about growing older and staying alive

profile:
The user continues to express a strong love for classic, lesser-known films, particularly within the science fiction and fantasy genres, and favors ensemble casts blending humor with heartwarming narratives. Their appreciation for adaptations of literary works shows a desire for deeper engagement with source material.

Recent interactions reveal an emerging interest in quirky, character-driven stories that explore complex themes, including critiques of organized religion, enriched by charm and moral undertones. They also enjoy light-hearted, action-packed comedies as a form of escapism, valuing strong actor chemistry and meaningful storytelling.

The latest interaction emphasizes the user’s attraction to films that address themes of aging and perspective, highlighting universal lessons and the impact of beliefs on perception. This indicates an ongoing exploration of thoughtful and poignant narratives that offer insights into various life stages. Additionally, their preference for classic musicals featuring iconic performances suggests an appreciation for nostalgia and the magic of timeless storytelling.

Overall, the user’s cinematic tastes showcase a beautifully diverse palette, blending whimsical comedies, meaningful narratives, and historical insights, reflecting a rich engagement with the film medium that spans various genres and themes.
